channel.title: My Scripting Language
channel.description:
Well, I started this project today... It has no real use but for me to learn... And it's pretty fun to program in my opinion. When starting, I planned on making it into an RSPS scripting language and making something in Java to load them. However, I'm just getting the basics done.
For the syntax, I thought of ASM and I decided to make it all command based.
Here's a screenshot the first successful build with error checking. [img]http://img339.imageshack.us/img339/1322/scriptrs1.png[/img]
And here's one with variable declaring and assigning, also with error checking. [img]http://img529.imageshack.us/img529/6670/scriptrs2.png[/img]
Finally, here's the latest. It doesn't show errors, but it's declaring and using variables both ways. [img]http://img132.imageshack.us/img132/3430/scriptrs3.png[/img]
So I posted to get opinions on how it is right now. Comment on the syntax, the colors, etc. Right now, it converts to Java (Note that it doesn't convert a string to String) for testing purposes. Oh and finally, it's not case-sensitive.
If you're wondering, you can use put strings and variables together. Here's an example if you don't know what I mean. [code]declare string str assign str test declare string str2 assign str2 Ok %str%22 yay[/code]And when converted to Java, it'd look like this. [code]String str; str = "test"; String str2; str2 = "Ok test22 yay";[/code]So it's all good.
[b]Types[/b] Boolean Int String
[b]Commands[/b] Declare Assign Store Release
Oh and uh, finally. With the % indicating a variable, you just insert another % after it, so it looks like %%. Then it will just insert a % sign and use the text after that. And one more thing: Never once did I use string.Replace.
Made in C#.
~Lin

item.title: My Scripting Language
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Okay, added math functions and final bug fixes. Now everything is fixed. It’s actually flexible and usable. It’s extremely useless but it’s cool to use.

Oh and for all you jackasses out there who think this shit’s easy, I’d like to see you do just like how I did.

Read full topic

item.title: My Scripting Language
item.dc:creator: @_ikram _ikram
item.description:
@_ikram wrote:

Good job lin, this is impressive.

But dont you think another scripting languge will confuse thing’s i mean Jagex use RuneScript and use trying to implement that into server’s is already an issue… We need to focus just on plain java, and us changing scripting methods will create lots of tension and we need to change our approch on each indavidual server, dont get me wrong Lin, it is nice what you have done and i wish you the best of luck.

Read full topic

item.title: My Scripting Language
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“casey., post:7, topic:287248”]you know the outside is nice to[/quote]Fuck you.

I fixed the bugs I didn’t know about and added some more error handling when trying to use a variable that didn’t exist. And finally, I added a print method which just prints something to the console box. Next up, since it’s command based and the way I have things set up, I’m going to add math functions via command. For example, mathadd variable value. Like I said, this will be command-based, so I don’t care.

Read full topic

item.title: My Scripting Language
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

No, this was for fun. And like I said, for testing purposes, it was converted to Java. Now, it actually does something and use the bottom box as a console. From there you can make it write text etc.

Just because there’s something else out there doesn’t mean I can’t make my own.

Read full topic

item.title: My Scripting Language
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

Why not just use BeanShell. It uses the same syntax as Java.

All your doing is making Java with different syntax, and your making the syntax more complex.

Read full topic

item.title: My Scripting Language
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Well, I started this project today… It has no real use but for me to learn… And it’s pretty fun to program in my opinion. When starting, I planned on making it into an RSPS scripting language and making something in Java to load them. However, I’m just getting the basics done.

For the syntax, I thought of ASM and I decided to make it all command based.

Here’s a screenshot the first successful build with error checking.

And here’s one with variable declaring and assigning, also with error checking.

Finally, here’s the latest. It doesn’t show errors, but it’s declaring and using variables both ways.

So I posted to get opinions on how it is right now. Comment on the syntax, the colors, etc. Right now, it converts to Java (Note that it doesn’t convert a string to String) for testing purposes. Oh and finally, it’s not case-sensitive.

If you’re wondering, you can use put strings and variables together. Here’s an example if you don’t know what I mean.

declare string str assign str test declare string str2 assign str2 Ok %str%22 yayAnd when converted to Java, it’d look like this.

String str; str = "test"; String str2; str2 = "Ok test22 yay";So it’s all good.

Types
Boolean
Int
String

Commands
Declare
Assign
Store
Release

Oh and uh, finally. With the % indicating a variable, you just insert another % after it, so it looks like %%. Then it will just insert a % sign and use the text after that. And one more thing: Never once did I use string.Replace.

Made in C#.

~Lin
